subject: Fw: Emily July 18 12pm CST  IDI Profile and Plan/Debrief with Patricia Coleman
body:
Hi Vince, 
Please see the email below. Emily has not shown up for three scheduled debriefs now. I'm not sure how you want to proceed with her debrief.
Thanks, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)

 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>

 Thursday, July 18, 2024 12:25 PM
To:
 Colletti, Emily (she/her/hers) <Emily.Colletti@bsci.com>
Cc:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Emily July 18 12pm CST IDI Profile and Plan/Debrief with Patricia Coleman
 
 
Dear Emily,
 
This is Patricia, your IDI Q.A assigned coach.
 
I am sorry I missed you yesterday 07/17 for your IDI profile debrief but got the message that you were delayed. 
 
Kaitlin rescheduled for today 07/18 @12pm CST and ZOOM room is open at least 5mn early.
 
Ou relationship with BSC is important and your time is very valuable.
 
As we all work from different time zones ( I am in FL/EST), I am inviting you to reschedule keeping me in copy so that one of us respond to better serve your schedule.
 
I have to sign off unfortunately as it is 12:22pm EST and we need 45mn to 1hr for the debrief.
 
Looking forward to hearing from you,
 
Respectfully, 
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)

subject: Reminder — upcoming changes to your Asana account
body:
Your Asana account needs attention
 
Review account
 
Dear Asana User,
 
Your attention is required because Asana is changing its 
email policy
 covering the use of email addresses with Asana accounts. These changes will enhance the security and privacy of your Asana accounts and will take effect after 
August 12
. You can also update your account now.
 
What this means for your data:
 
Your current account will be separated into new accounts, but 
you will not lose access to your data
. You will receive a registration link to activate your new accounts and can navigate between accounts using Asana's 
Account Switcher
.
 
What about app integrations?
 
After the change, you will need to restore permissions for any apps used in Organizations and Workspaces that migrate to new user accounts.
 
Asana understands these changes might require some planning, but they're designed to enhance the security of your Asana account. That's a top priority for us.
 
See you online,
The Asana Team

subject: GroupM Culture of Inclusion Workshop - Working Title :-)
body:
Hi Sarah and Vince,
 
Hope you’re both well.
 
Right after our meeting this week do you mind sending along the revised version of the Culture of Inclusion presentation.  I’d like to send it along to my new boss to give her visibility into what we’ve been working on and about to roll out.  I made her aware that it’s a presentation workshop with a lot of voice over from the facilitator to manage her expectations as she goes through it.
 
As a reminder, I will be out of the office starting this Friday until Monday, Aug. 5
th
.  If you need anything urgent Brian and Safa will be around.
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Lukeisha Paul M. Div.
(She/Her/Hers)
Head of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, GroupM US
— 
m: (917) 938-5470
3 World Trade Center, 16
th
 Floor
175 Greenwich Street
New York, NY 10007
—
www.groupm.com
@groupmworldwide
Follow us on LinkedIn

A safe space. A listening ear. A trusted ally.
BLACK LIVES MATTER.

body:

I’ve attached the revised slides.  Please let me know if anything needs to be changed. 
 
Thanks,
~Keri
 
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 15, 2024 9:51 AM
To:
 Keri Luo <k.luo@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Sustainable Culture of Inclusion images
 
Oooh, this looks cool! Thank you! I have one more request. We have been talking about changing up the model a bit…Can you take the “Exclusionary” box and make it extend all the way over to the right, covering up the “Unstable” box. We decided to eliminate the Unstable category altogether, and just have Exclusionary be the whole bottom part of the model. Does that make sense? It should NOT have arrows pointing up on the part that covers the current Unstable box. 
 
Let me know if that makes sense:
 
 
 
From:
 Keri Luo <
k.luo@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, July 12, 2024 4:21 PM
To:
 Sarah Nodarse <
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Sustainable Culture of Inclusion images
 
Hi Sarah,
I used the image that we did last time for the first slide and made some adjustments for the second slide. Please let me know if more simplification is needed.
 
Have a good weekend!
 
~Keri
 
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 11, 2024 11:17 AM
To:
 Keri Luo <
k.luo@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Sustainable Culture of Inclusion images
 
Hi Keri! Thank you so much for the Maple Grove deck for BSC, it looks great. I am using the Sustainable Culture of Inclusion slides in a few different presentations at the moment (this one, and also for WomenLift Health). The two slides attached keep getting pushback from the clients, they say the images are still too busy and complex. Which, they are, because of all the information we are trying to convey! I wanted to throw these back to you and see if you would be able to take some time to work on making them even more streamlined and simple. Let me know what you think – this isn’t super urgent but one of the workshops is a week from today. The other one is the following week.
 
Thanks,
Sarah

October 7, 8, 9, 10, 14, 15, 22,, 23, 24, 25

subject: Action needed — upcoming changes to your Asana account
body:
Your Asana account needs attention
 
Review account
 
Dear Asana User,
 
Your attention is required because Asana is changing its 
email policy
 covering the use of email addresses with Asana accounts. These changes will enhance the security and privacy of your Asana accounts and will take effect after 
August 12
. You can also update your account now.
 
What this means for your data:
 
Your current account will be separated into new accounts, but 
you will not lose access to your data
. You will receive a registration link to activate your new accounts and can navigate between accounts using Asana's 
Account Switcher
.
 
What about app integrations?
 
After the change, you will need to restore permissions for any apps used in Organizations and Workspaces that migrate to new user accounts.
 
Asana understands these changes might require some planning, but they're designed to enhance the security of your Asana account. That's a top priority for us.
 
See you online,
The Asana Team

Hi Hollina,
It was a pleasure e-meeting you and the amazing team of leaders and colleagues involved in this initiative.  I am always inspired when I see talented leaders invested in their people and in creating diverse and inclusive spaces for all within their organizations. To follow up on Patricia’s email below, I don’t have any specific request and since there will be multiple groups rotating, I prefer to leave it up to you and your team to figure out what will be the best room setting considering a minimum disruption between sessions and the layouts of the room.
 
As mentioned in our call, I will adapt accordingly as I sense the climate during each session. Let me know if you need anything else from me.  As discussed in previous communication with LCW, my goal is to be there 1 hour prior to the start of each day. Thank you for the support and have a fantastic rest of the week.
 
Best Regards,
Ricardo Núñez

s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Meeting follow up to set up Alpharetta session july 16&17
 
Hello again,
 
Great meeting Hollina! Thank you for setting it up.
 
I am inviting Ricardo to make any special request in reply to this email as far as room set up especially about tables / chairs and space to move around and connect with audience. 
 
Also, one question we both have is whether leaders speaking at beginning will use the text we have in notes:
 
Alpharetta leader, sharing what is next on our journey of inclusion
We are committed to a culture of inclusion here at the Alpharetta site. In March, we participated in workshops in order to:
Understand the impact of race at work drawing upon example from the Black/African-American community
Build empathy to have honest and/or courageous conversations
Create space for tackling tough subjects in today’s context
Now, we are continuing the conversation, diving into learning more about the Hispanic and Latino community, but also picking up the conversation about inclusion more generally.
Later this summer, we will launch Embracing Diversity onboarding sessions, so that all employees, including new ones, understand that inclusion is part of Alpharetta’s DNA. These sessions will be offered on a regular, ongoing basis, to introduce new employees to how they can contribute to our inclusive culture. 
Now, I will turn it over to our partner at LCW, Ricardo to lead us into our workshop. 
 
This was translated in Spanish giving the native speaker the option to change language  of certain words in line with region as s/he wishes.
 
El líder de Alpharetta, comparte cómo sigue nuestro viaje de inclusión
En Alpharetta estamos comprometidos con una cultura de inclusión. En marzo, participamos en talleres con el fin de:
Comprender el impacto de las razas en el trabajo haciendo uso del ejemplo de la comunidad negra/afroamericana
Generar empatía para poder tener conversaciones honestas y/o valientes
Crear espacio para enfrentar los asuntos en el contexto actual
Ahora, continuamos la conversación, profundizando en aprender más sobre la comunidad hispana y latina, pero también retomar la conversación sobre la inclusión de manera más general.
Más adelante, durante este verano, comenzaremos las sesiones de Abrazar la Diversidad para nuevos ingresados, de manera que todos los empleados, incluso los nuevos, comprendan que la inclusión forma parte del ADN de Alpharetta. Estas sesiones se ofrecerán de manera regular y continua para que los nuevos empleados sepan cómo pueden aportar a nuestra cultura inclusiva.
Ahora, le dejo el lugar a Ricardo, nuestro socio de LCW, quién nos presentará este taller.
 
 
Thanks Hollina,
 
Best
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Let me know if you need anything else from me.  As discussed in previous communication with LCW, my goal is to be there 1 hour prior to the start of each day. Thank you for the support and have a fantastic rest of the week.
 
Best Regards,
Ricardo Núñez

 Monday, July 8, 2024 9:13 AM
To:
 Ung, Hollina (she/her/hers) <

>

nunezenterprises@comcast.net
; Sarah Nodarse <
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Meeting follow up to set up Alpharetta session july 16&17
 
Hello again,
 
Great meeting Hollina! Thank you for setting it up.
 
I am inviting Ricardo to make any special request in reply to this email as far as room set up especially about tables / chairs and space to move around and connect with audience. 
 
Also, one question we both have is whether leaders speaking at beginning will use the text we have in notes:
 
Alpharetta leader, sharing what is next on our journey of inclusion
We are committed to a culture of inclusion here at the Alpharetta site. In March, we participated in workshops in order to:
Understand the impact of race at work drawing upon example from the Black/African-American community
Build empathy to have honest and/or courageous conversations
Create space for tackling tough subjects in today’s context
Now, we are continuing the conversation, diving into learning more about the Hispanic and Latino community, but also picking up the conversation about inclusion more generally.
Later this summer, we will launch Embracing Diversity onboarding sessions, so that all employees, including new ones, understand that inclusion is part of Alpharetta’s DNA. These sessions will be offered on a regular, ongoing basis, to introduce new employees to how they can contribute to our inclusive culture. 
Now, I will turn it over to our partner at LCW, Ricardo to lead us into our workshop. 
 
This was translated in Spanish giving the native speaker the option to change language  of certain words in line with region as s/he wishes.
 
El líder de Alpharetta, comparte cómo sigue nuestro viaje de inclusión
En Alpharetta estamos comprometidos con una cultura de inclusión. En marzo, participamos en talleres con el fin de:
Comprender el impacto de las razas en el trabajo haciendo uso del ejemplo de la comunidad negra/afroamericana
Generar empatía para poder tener conversaciones honestas y/o valientes
Crear espacio para enfrentar los asuntos en el contexto actual
Ahora, continuamos la conversación, profundizando en aprender más sobre la comunidad hispana y latina, pero también retomar la conversación sobre la inclusión de manera más general.
Más adelante, durante este verano, comenzaremos las sesiones de Abrazar la Diversidad para nuevos ingresados, de manera que todos los empleados, incluso los nuevos, comprendan que la inclusión forma parte del ADN de Alpharetta. Estas sesiones se ofrecerán de manera regular y continua para que los nuevos empleados sepan cómo pueden aportar a nuestra cultura inclusiva.
Ahora, le dejo el lugar a Ricardo, nuestro socio de LCW, quién nos presentará este taller.
 
 
Thanks Hollina,
 
Best
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Hi – providing answers to your questions in advance of our meeting today.
 
See below in 
blue.
 
Talk to you in a few hours!
 
-S
 
From:
 Chan, Bethany (she/her/hers) <Bethany.Chan@bsci.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 9, 2024 11:45 AM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Bird, Shani (she/her/hers) <Shani.Bird@bsci.com>
Subject:
 RE: {External} RE: ARCH - Notes from today's call.
 
Hi Sarah and Vince,
 
In reviewing the APAC I went in and found slide numbers on my own where I could. Can you confirm and add in remaining slide numbers?
 
Notes say “Focus on accents, and how certain people travel more than others. Slide with study by SAP.” – Can you confirm if this is slide 20? 
Yes
Notes say “Diminishing one people group…” – can you confirm this is slide 28? 
Yes and 29
Notes say “One of the leaders brought up comparisons with other countries, and we bring that in by comparing countries within the region throughout the training.” – Can you let me know which slides? 
Slide 20, Singapore, slides 27-29, India, China, Japan, Malaysia
Note say “gender diversity is mentioned in the talk track” – Can you let me know which slides? 
Slide 18 (added a bullet that was missing on women leaders)
 
Notes on initial review:
Some initial thoughts – slide titled “The Goal”: Cultural Competence, is #BlackLivesMatter and #AllLivesMatter a trending topic in Canada, LatAm and APAC? 
This slide is common to all versions, but the hashtags can be removed outside of North America. We will confirm with the SMEs.
APAC slides on first review are looking very US focused/themed to me. 
42 looks US focused to me as we don’t want to fucus on the Black experience exclusively for this group
. I edited this slide to read “multicultural” for APAC. The tailoring on this slide is in the language, how we refer to “Black” or “multicultural” talent. The previous version you saw had LATAM language, sorry about that. 
Slide 4
 – 
This is the same for all versions, we may want to ensure all this language is current
Slide 8
 -
These are the learning objectives, which are the same for all versions. However, we changed language to “Black and multicultural”. As for slide 42, 
the tailoring on this slide is in the language, how we refer to “Black” or “multicultural” talent. The previous version you saw had LATAM language, sorry about that. 
Slide 9 – 
This is the agenda slide, basically the same for all versions except in how we refer to Black talent – changed language to “Black and multicultural”
Slide 12, Slide 13, Slide 14, Slide 15, Slide 16, for APAC again focuses/calls out Black talent. I think instead we’d like to see another group here, women here for example.
 
As of now, we have these brief slides on Black talent in the US in all versions. This is to meet the mandate of educating all BSC employees across the globe about the experience of their Black colleagues in the US. If this is no longer the mandate, we can switch these slides out for information on another group. However, this will definitely weaken the focus on anti-racism…In any case, since your review I have updated all three new versions to include the region-specific quiz right after these US-focused slides, and then the breakout, which will be focused on the regional data
.
Slides speak to the ARCH discussion guides – are new guides being developed/translated for these regions? Any resources we give need to be region appropriate. 
We had not planned to update the discussion guides for the regions, as they are focused on a specific approach from Race Forward. I have removed any mention of them outside North America. We can add this to the scope if desired
Are all groups receiving this same pre-work? 
"How Much Do You Know About African American/Black Talent?" is referenced in Slide 1 of each. This should be appropriate for and specific to each region. I think if we send this resource out to APAC for example, ahead of the session your facilitator may receive resistance from participants.
 
We will either have to tailor the prework per region, or not include it.
Are these the finalized talk tracks for each slide?
 
No, these are still in progress.
 
Please note that I have gone through each deck since your review and updated each one to make them all more consistent with each other. There are v2s in the 
folder on SharePoint
. I have also made a spreadsheet (attached) that will help us compare versions.
 
-S
 
Thanks,
Bethany
 
Bethany Chan, Ph.D.
Principal DE&I L&D Specialist
Enterprise Talent Management

Hi Sarah and Vince, 
 
I've been following the updates via Patricia's emails. I added the events in the Compass facilitation calendar. Are they showing on your outlook calendar? I've been having some issues with them showing. Just for my info, do you have to accept these events for them to go on your calendar?

Subject:
 BSC Alpharetta FINAL schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish 
 
Dear Team,
 
Here is agenda with times and language for Alpharetta.
Vince, can you please update Briza & Kaitlin for Scoro/Compass?
 
Ricardo, I will try to find out how many people in each session as well as if there will be bilingual people in ENG sessions, same question for SPA sessions. We do have meeting on Monday to ask these questions as well.
 
16-Jul
17-Jul
DL Span 8:00 AM
DL Eng 8:00 AM
DL Span 10:00 AM
DL Eng 10:00 AM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
*DL Eng 3:05 PM
DL Span  3:05 AM
DL Eng 4:30 PM
 
 
Ricardo,
I have received confirmation that lunch will be provided both days – the Alpharetta leadership team and Hollina Ung will plan to use this time to check in with you, Ricardo to see how things are going. 
 
The request for you to access the site at 7:00 AM on both days will not be a problem.
 
Additionally, the Alpharetta leadership team has offered to do dinner together on Tuesday evening as well if you are up for it (
They recognize that it will be a long day for him, going from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM onsite so they will follow your cue on this one)
.  
Ricardo, kindly confirm if you will consider doing diner. I am sure you can discuss /decide on Monday during meeting. It will be all about energy. 
 
Thanks everyone and in case we do not communicate further today, have a great FOURTH of JULY Holiday. 
 
PLEASE NOTE
: LCW is open on Friday. I am available until 1pm that day.
 
Best
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

Subject:

Hi Sarah and Vince,
 
In reviewing the APAC I went in and found slide numbers on my own where I could. Can you confirm and add in remaining slide numbers?
 
Notes say “Focus on accents, and how certain people travel more than others. Slide with study by SAP.” – Can you confirm if this is slide 20?
 Yes, slide 20
Notes say “Diminishing one people group…” – can you confirm this is slide 28? 
Yes, slide 28
Notes say “One of the leaders brought up comparisons with other countries, and we bring that in by comparing countries within the region throughout the training.” – Can you let me know which slides?
 21, 24, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31, 34, 35, 37
Note say “gender diversity is mentioned in the talk track” – Can you let me know which slides? 
I could not find the specific slides, but have reached out to Brain for clarification and will let you know.
 
Notes on initial review:
Some initial thoughts – slide titled “The Goal”: Cultural Competence, is #BlackLivesMatter and #AllLivesMatter a trending topic in Canada, LatAm and APAC?
APAC slides on first review are looking very US focused/themed to me. 42 looks US focused to me as we don’t want to fucus on the Black experience exclusively for this group. 
Slide 4, Slide 8, Slide 9, Slide 12, Slide 13, Slide 14, Slide 15, Slide 16, for APAC again focuses/calls out Black talent. I think instead we’d like to see another group here, women here for example.
Slides speak to the ARCH discussion guides – are new guides being developed/translated for these regions? Any resources we give need to be region appropriate.
Are all groups receiving this same pre-work? 
"How Much Do You Know About African American/Black Talent?" is referenced in Slide 1 of each. This should be appropriate for and specific to each region. I think if we send this resource out to APAC for example, ahead of the session your facilitator may receive resistance from participants.
Are these the finalized talk tracks for each slide?
 
Thanks,
Bethany

subject: Re: {External} RE: ARCH - Notes from today's call.
body:
Hi Bethany,
My apologies for not being more specific with APAC. I have responded to your slide questions in blue below. 
Best,
Vince
From:
 Chan, Bethany (she/her/hers) <Bethany.Chan@bsci.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 9, 2024 11:45 AM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Bird, Shani (she/her/hers) <Shani.Bird@bsci.com>
Subject:
 RE: {External} RE: ARCH - Notes from today's call.
 
 
Hi Sarah and Vince,
 
In reviewing the APAC I went in and found slide numbers on my own where I could. Can you confirm and add in remaining slide numbers?
 
Notes say “Focus on accents, and how certain people travel more than others. Slide with study by SAP.” – Can you confirm if this is slide 20?
 Yes, slide 20
Notes say “Diminishing one people group…” – can you confirm this is slide 28? 
Yes, slide 28
Notes say “One of the leaders brought up comparisons with other countries, and we bring that in by comparing countries within the region throughout the training.” – Can you let me know which slides?
 21, 24, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31, 34, 35, 37
Note say “gender diversity is mentioned in the talk track” – Can you let me know which slides? 
I could not find the specific slides, but have reached out to Brain for clarification and will let you know.
 
Notes on initial review:
Some initial thoughts – slide titled “The Goal”: Cultural Competence, is #BlackLivesMatter and #AllLivesMatter a trending topic in Canada, LatAm and APAC?
APAC slides on first review are looking very US focused/themed to me. 42 looks US focused to me as we don’t want to fucus on the Black experience exclusively for this group. 
Slide 4, Slide 8, Slide 9, Slide 12, Slide 13, Slide 14, Slide 15, Slide 16, for APAC again focuses/calls out Black talent. I think instead we’d like to see another group here, women here for example.
Slides speak to the ARCH discussion guides – are new guides being developed/translated for these regions? Any resources we give need to be region appropriate.
Are all groups receiving this same pre-work? 
"How Much Do You Know About African American/Black Talent?" is referenced in Slide 1 of each. This should be appropriate for and specific to each region. I think if we send this resource out to APAC for example, ahead of the session your facilitator may receive resistance from participants.
Are these the finalized talk tracks for each slide?
 
Thanks,
Bethany
 
Bethany Chan, Ph.D.
Principal DE&I L&D Specialist
Enterprise Talent Management
Pronouns: (she/her/hers)
bethany.chan@bsci.com
4100 Hamline Ave N
Arden Hills, MN
www.bostonscientific.com

subject: Re: BSC Alpharetta FINAL  schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish
body:
Hi Sarah and Vince, 
I've been following the updates via Patricia's emails. I added the events in the Compass facilitation calendar. Are they showing on your outlook calendar? I've been having some issues with them showing. Just for my info, do you have to accept these events for them to go on your calendar? 
When I went to the SOW to make sure the dates are correct, I saw two events- I think because of the difference in pricing. I've copied a picture below. Please let me know if that is not correct and I need to change it. 
Thanks, 
Kaitlin 
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, July 8, 2024 12:25 PM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: BSC Alpharetta FINAL schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish 
 
Hiya friends,
Kaitlin, welcome aboard, it’s good to have you here. I have been OOO and didn’t see any emails go through on this, so thought I’d bring it to the top of the inboxes.
 
We just need to adjust the times for these events in Compass – they happen next week. This project belongs to SOW 2023-100 for the record.
 
Thanks,
Sarah
 
From:
 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 3, 2024 8:25 AM
To:
 nunezenterprises@comcast.net
Cc:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 BSC Alpharetta FINAL schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish 
 
Dear Team,
 
Here is agenda with times and language for Alpharetta.
Vince, can you please update Briza & Kaitlin for Scoro/Compass?
 
Ricardo, I will try to find out how many people in each session as well as if there will be bilingual people in ENG sessions, same question for SPA sessions. We do have meeting on Monday to ask these questions as well.
 
16-Jul
17-Jul
DL Span 8:00 AM
DL Eng 8:00 AM
DL Span 10:00 AM
DL Eng 10:00 AM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
*DL Eng 3:05 PM
DL Span  3:05 AM
DL Eng 4:30 PM
 
 
Ricardo,
I have received confirmation that lunch will be provided both days – the Alpharetta leadership team and Hollina Ung will plan to use this time to check in with you, Ricardo to see how things are going. 
 
The request for you to access the site at 7:00 AM on both days will not be a problem.
 
Additionally, the Alpharetta leadership team has offered to do dinner together on Tuesday evening as well if you are up for it (
They recognize that it will be a long day for him, going from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM onsite so they will follow your cue on this one)
.  
Ricardo, kindly confirm if you will consider doing diner. I am sure you can discuss /decide on Monday during meeting. It will be all about energy. 
 
Thanks everyone and in case we do not communicate further today, have a great FOURTH of JULY Holiday. 
 
PLEASE NOTE
: LCW is open on Friday. I am available until 1pm that day.
 
Best
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant

subject: RE: {External} RE: ARCH - Notes from today's call.
body:
Hi Sarah and Vince,
 
In reviewing the APAC I went in and found slide numbers on my own where I could. Can you confirm and add in remaining slide numbers?
 
Notes say “Focus on accents, and how certain people travel more than others. Slide with study by SAP.” – Can you confirm if this is slide 20?
Notes say “Diminishing one people group…” – can you confirm this is slide 28?
Notes say “One of the leaders brought up comparisons with other countries, and we bring that in by comparing countries within the region throughout the training.” – Can you let me know which slides?
Note say “gender diversity is mentioned in the talk track” – Can you let me know which slides?
 
Notes on initial review:
Some initial thoughts – slide titled “The Goal”: Cultural Competence, is #BlackLivesMatter and #AllLivesMatter a trending topic in Canada, LatAm and APAC?
APAC slides on first review are looking very US focused/themed to me. 42 looks US focused to me as we don’t want to fucus on the Black experience exclusively for this group. 
Slide 4, Slide 8, Slide 9, Slide 12, Slide 13, Slide 14, Slide 15, Slide 16, for APAC again focuses/calls out Black talent. I think instead we’d like to see another group here, women here for example.
Slides speak to the ARCH discussion guides – are new guides being developed/translated for these regions? Any resources we give need to be region appropriate.
Are all groups receiving this same pre-work? 
"How Much Do You Know About African American/Black Talent?" is referenced in Slide 1 of each. This should be appropriate for and specific to each region. I think if we send this resource out to APAC for example, ahead of the session your facilitator may receive resistance from participants.
Are these the finalized talk tracks for each slide?
 
Thanks,
Bethany

subject: RE: Need your expertise
body:
Hi Olivia – 
 
This sounds great. We would like to move forward. We are working right now on whittling down the text a bit to offset the concern for too much voice over. 
 
In the meantime, I’d like to get a sense of next steps and timeline. I imagine that next steps include me giving you an updated text as per the above, us reviewing the course together to make some decisions about text vs. voice-over and the like, and then you doing the final production. Is that about correct? How long will it take you to do that production work?
 
Vince (copied here) is going to help with project management, so he will set up a check point for us to get us started. What is your availability this week?
 
Thanks,
Sarah

From:
 Olivia Kippax Jones <olivia.kippax.jones@brightcarbon.com>

Cc:

Subject:
 RE: Need your expertise
 
Hi Chuck, 
 
Hope you had a good weekend! 
 
We do have an 
eLearning
 
revamp
 service that includes:
New visuals
Simple visualisation 
Sympathetic animation 
In this service we don’t significantly rework or rewrite content or write interactions etc, but we can move the course into Storyline and give it a refresh and add some basic animation and keep the interactions you have already written. 
 
I sat and worked through the course today as it stands, and it took me about 20 minutes. For 20 minutes of learning eLearning revamp costs 
$12,250
. 
 
We usually charge a higher fee of $13,950 for adding narration but I’d be happy to waive that addition bump in view of our previous partnership. That said, the scope of this project would not cover fully animating and narrating this course as it is dense so would end up being 
much
 longer if fully narrated. We can advise on a balance between VO and text – but I’d want the client to know that there would still be a lot of read content. 
 
Let me know if you have any questions about this scoping. 
 
All the best,

Subject:
 Need your expertise
 
Cheers, Olivia!
 
Sarah has a client who we built a Rise module for who would rather have it in Storyline so that it better resembles our approach to modules of ours that they already own. The scroll down nature of Rise wasn’t very attractive. They also want learners to interact with content more, engage with more video, and have a VO. Finally they want to make sure that learners can’t just click through the content.
 
We are hoping we can get that done for somewhere around $10k-ish. Is this possible? 
 
The link below is the course in its current state:
 
(v2) Valuing Diversity for Innovation: Culture, Race and Difference in our BSC Workplaces | Review 360 (articulate.com)
 
They liked the content itself. I wasn’t really happy with the design aesthetic—too blocked off, not enough whitespace and elegance.
 
Best,
 
Chuck

subject: FW: BSC Alpharetta FINAL  schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish
body:
Hiya friends,
Kaitlin, welcome aboard, it’s good to have you here. I have been OOO and didn’t see any emails go through on this, so thought I’d bring it to the top of the inboxes.
 
We just need to adjust the times for these events in Compass – they happen next week. This project belongs to SOW 2023-100 for the record.
 
Thanks,
Sarah

 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 BSC Alpharetta FINAL schedule for 9 sessions English vs Spanish 
 
Dear Team,
 
Here is agenda with times and language for Alpharetta.
Vince, can you please update Briza & Kaitlin for Scoro/Compass?
 
Ricardo, I will try to find out how many people in each session as well as if there will be bilingual people in ENG sessions, same question for SPA sessions. We do have meeting on Monday to ask these questions as well.
 
16-Jul
17-Jul
DL Span 8:00 AM
DL Eng 8:00 AM
DL Span 10:00 AM
DL Eng 10:00 AM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
IDL Eng 1:00 PM
*DL Eng 3:05 PM
DL Span  3:05 AM
DL Eng 4:30 PM
 
 
Ricardo,
I have received confirmation that lunch will be provided both days – the Alpharetta leadership team and Hollina Ung will plan to use this time to check in with you, Ricardo to see how things are going. 
 
The request for you to access the site at 7:00 AM on both days will not be a problem.
 
Additionally, the Alpharetta leadership team has offered to do dinner together on Tuesday evening as well if you are up for it (
They recognize that it will be a long day for him, going from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM onsite so they will follow your cue on this one)
.  
Ricardo, kindly confirm if you will consider doing diner. I am sure you can discuss /decide on Monday during meeting. It will be all about energy. 
 
Thanks everyone and in case we do not communicate further today, have a great FOURTH of JULY Holiday. 
 
PLEASE NOTE
: LCW is open on Friday. I am available until 1pm that day.
 
Best
 
Patricia M Coleman

subject: YS Herald: Back to square one - 07.24
body:
View this email in your browser
Hello !
Can you believe it is already JULY?! 
Your YS Board been quiet for a while, but we are coming back (to the basics) with a bang - and asking for a wee bit of interaction this month.
We have a lot of plans. Of course, we aren't 'spilling 
all
 the beans' in this issue - we have to save some good news for next month too (For those dog days of summer).
Who said these summer months were supposed to be quiet?!
Upcoming event
We are happy to announce we are hosting “The Olympics: Intercultural Sports Arena” presented by Allison Iurato of altointercultural.
The workshop will explore the intersection and discourses of the sports, geopolitics and interculturalism, and the participants will walk away with new reflections, talking points and examples to bring back to their intercultural trainings.
When: 25.07.24 
Time: 4:00 pm CET 
Where: online
Members register 
here
. Then, invite your non-member friends to join 
here
.
But wait, there is more…
Since we are back at it, here is a bit more information we can share with you. 
YS Index of Female Expatriation
As you may have seen in a recent email from our research team spent much of 2023 and 2024 looking into female expatriation.
You can find their results 
here
.
Help us decide what to read in 2024/ 2025. 
Rate the books listed in 
this quick poll
. If you don't entirely like what you see, suggest more books by reaching out on social media or via email.
Additionally, 
here is a second poll
 to help us find the best time to meet.
You are the beating heart of Young SIETAR - this is why we are reaching out to you in helping us shape the next YS event. What are you passionate about in the intercultural world? Where do you think should the next YS event take place? Why do you think your idea and concept is relevanGet active and be part of the next event, help shape YS and the intercultural world and experience organising an event from the beginning.
Do you have an idea for an intercultural workshop that you 
a) would like to trial or, 
b) about something you wish you would have known when you started out in the intercultural / cross-cultural training / education?
Well, we are looking for workshop ideas from our members and fans of Young SIETAR! Click on the link to share your ideas with us 
here
.
We are looking for writers and workshop/lesson creators to write for us.
Do you have an intercultural story, lesson, or activity to share with our members? We are looking to increase our digital engagement (via social media and our website), this means increasing the usefulness of the things we share - Help us by sharing your wisdom.
Fill out 
this form
 with your ideas.
Copyright (C) 2024 Young SIETAR. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you opted in via our website. 
Our mailing address is:
Young SIETAR Karel De Vijfdestraat 5 'S-Hertogenbosch, Brabant 5216 AP Netherlands 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

subject: New Bi-Weekly Timesheet Submission to Payables Process
body:
Good afternoon, 
 
We’ve made a few changes to the existing process on submitting your bi-weekly timesheet for payment processing. 
 
Going forward, you will email 
payablelcw@bill.com
 directly and cc’ Chuck, instead of letting us know your timesheet is ready for review and us sending it off to that email for processing. Attached is the step-by-step process. You can also find it here:
 
I’ll be emailing you individually with the template I use to send over to payables if you would like to use that. 
 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas

subject: Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
body:
Hi Vince
Sounds good and understand.
I would be open to the ANZ program.  Let me revise my bio slightly for that and jet it to you.  
Brian
Sent from 
Outlook for Android
From:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Friday, June 28, 2024 2:24:02 PM
To:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>
Subject:
 Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
 
 
Hi Brian,
Thank you for getting these to me. Unfortunately, the client would like to go with a culture native for APAC. However, they liked your bio and would love to consider you for the Australian sessions. If that is something you would be interested in, just let me know. 
Thanks again and have a great weekend!
Best,
Vince
From:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>
Sent:
 Monday, June 24, 2024 4:01 PM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
 
 
Hi Vince
Thank you for getting in touch on this.  I'd be happy to serve LCW and BSC with these sessions.
An initial quick look would be the following dates:
18 September / Wednesday
1 October / Tuesday (Golden Week Holiday in China, so less likely to attract people there but regionally should be fine)
8-10 October / Tuesday - Thursday (ideally 8 or 9 rather than 10 October)
28 November AFTERNOON ONLY / Thursday
Would something like this be doable, or would you like additional dates to offer?  If so please let me know and I can get those to you asap today or tomorrow.  I have other slots I could offer throughout autumn until the winter holidays.
Best regards
Brian
From:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 24 June 2024 11:31 PM
To:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>
Subject:
 Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
 
 
Hi Brian,
I hope you had a nice weekend.
I wanted to confirm your willingness to facilitate the APAC sessions for Leading Inclusively this Fall, as well as get an idea of your general availability. We are planning on doing 5 sessions in total, and BSC would prefer not to do them on Mondays or Fridays. So if you could send over some date windows, as well as time of day, that would work best for you, that would be much appreciated.
Thank you!
Vince
Vince Bongiovanni
(he/him)
Project Assistant
LCW

subject: FW: Content and This Week's Meeting
body:
Please cancel this week’s GroupM meeting – thanks!
 
From:
 Lukeisha Paul <Lukeisha.Paul@groupm.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 1, 2024 12:03 PM
To:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Brian Dashew <brian.dashew@groupm.com>
Subject:
 RE: Content and This Week's Meeting
 
Hi Sarah,                                                             
 
Hope you had a good weekend as well.
 
Yes, let’s cancel this week so you and the team can complete.   Based on my conversation with Alisa she will be going through the content and flow with yourself and greater team to get the deck to completion.  
 
I don’t think Brian and I should go through the presentation at this point as I anticipate changes.  If you think otherwise after your internal assessment let us know. 
 
Looking forward to when we meet next.  In the interim let us know if you need anything.
 
Thank you, 
 
 
Lukeisha Paul M. Div.
(She/Her/Hers)
Head of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, GroupM US
— 
m: (917) 938-5470
3 World Trade Center, 16
th
 Floor
175 Greenwich Street
New York, NY 10007
—
www.groupm.com
@groupmworldwide
Follow us on LinkedIn
 
Hi, I’m a Mental Health Ally.
A safe space. A listening ear. A trusted ally.
BLACK LIVES MATTER.
 
 
 
 
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 1, 2024 9:52 AM
To:
 Lukeisha Paul <
Lukeisha.Paul@groupm.com
>
Cc:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Content and This Week's Meeting
 
External:
 
 
Good morning Lukeisha – I hope you had a good weekend.
 
Alisa debriefed me on your conversation (thanks for the heads up by the way!), and she let me know that you would like to see a 95% complete deck by next Wednesday, and cancel this week’s meeting to give us time to focus on the edits. Can you confirm this is what you’d like to do? This schedule works for us.
 
Also, I’m eager to hear any detailed feedback that you and Brian have after having a chance to read through the deck and speaker notes. I plan to meet with Rebecca to integrate your feedback this week (I am in the office today and tomorrow). 
 
Thanks and talk soon,
Sarah
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
(she/her)
Principal Consultant
LCW
4753 N Broadway, Flr. 2
Chicago, IL 60640
 
773-828-6781 (office)
773-474-9138 (direct)
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
 
Website | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn
View our upcoming events | Sign-up for our newsletter
 
I live and work in Chicago, IL – on the unceded territory of the Pokagon band of Potawatomi. See 
this article
 in the Chicago History Museum Magazine for a native perspective on land acknowledgements and the City of Chicago.

subject: YS GA 2024 Notes and follow up
body:
Young SIETAR GA 2024
 
 
 
YS GA 2024 Results & follow up
June 29, 2024
 
 
 
 
 
Dear Vincent,
On behalf of the Young SIETAR Board, we would thank those of you who were able to attend this year's 
Young SIETAR 
General Assembly, which was held this morning, 
Saturday, June 29th, 2024 at 10 am  CET
.
Whether you were able to attend or not, we would now like to invite you to review our notes  from the meeting. 
Please find enclosed the official document 
YS GA 2024 Document
 for this year's General Assembly (click on the link to download). 
It contains detailed information about the topics we covered during the GA. Most importantly we were able to elect three new board members. However, we will  require follow up to hopefully elect two more members - stay tuned. 
If you have any questions regarding the contents of this GA, please do not hesitate to contact us. Additionally, if you feel inspired after reviewing the document and have some ideas of how you would like us to proceed, please do get in touch! 
Interculturally yours,
The Young SIETAR Board
currently comprised of
Veronique, Cédric, Soyoung, VyVy, Ji-Ju, and Christina
 
 
Follow us:
 
LinkedIn
 | 
Instagram
 | 
Facebook
 
Copyright © 2019 Young SIETAR. All rights reserved.
Contact email: 
board@youngsietar.org
You are receiving this message because you opted in at 
www.youngsietar.org
Unsubscribe

subject: Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
body:
Hi Brian,
Thank you for getting these to me. Unfortunately, the client would like to go with a culture native for APAC. However, they liked your bio and would love to consider you for the Australian sessions. If that is something you would be interested in, just let me know. 
Thanks again and have a great weekend!
Best,
Vince
From:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>
Sent:
 Monday, June 24, 2024 4:01 PM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
 
 
Hi Vince
Thank you for getting in touch on this.  I'd be happy to serve LCW and BSC with these sessions.
An initial quick look would be the following dates:
18 September / Wednesday
1 October / Tuesday (Golden Week Holiday in China, so less likely to attract people there but regionally should be fine)
8-10 October / Tuesday - Thursday (ideally 8 or 9 rather than 10 October)
28 November AFTERNOON ONLY / Thursday
Would something like this be doable, or would you like additional dates to offer?  If so please let me know and I can get those to you asap today or tomorrow.  I have other slots I could offer throughout autumn until the winter holidays.
Best regards
Brian
From:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 24 June 2024 11:31 PM
To:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>
Subject:
 Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
 
 
Hi Brian,
I hope you had a nice weekend.
I wanted to confirm your willingness to facilitate the APAC sessions for Leading Inclusively this Fall, as well as get an idea of your general availability. We are planning on doing 5 sessions in total, and BSC would prefer not to do them on Mondays or Fridays. So if you could send over some date windows, as well as time of day, that would work best for you, that would be much appreciated.
Thank you!
Vince

body:
Hi Hollina,
Attached is the pdf of the slide deck for the Maple grove workshop. Please note the following:
Slide 33 is an activity that will be placed onto flip charts, and participants will be asked to populate it with items from slide 32
Slide 41 - 42 may be subject to change as we determine ways to get participants to think more strategically, as right now it is a tactical approach
Also, Sarah has booked her travel arrangements, and Latoya is in the process of doing so.
Let me know if you need anything further in preparation for our next meeting, or if you have any questions about that deck, for which I would be happy to answer.
Best,
Vince

subject: Invitation to the GA 2024
body:
Young SIETAR GA 2024
 
 
 
Invitation to the GA 2024
 
 
 
 
 
Dear Vincent,
It's that time of the year for (digital) General Assemblies and we as YoungSietar have been doing digital GAs for many years. 
GAs are an important part of any organisation and this year we as a board would encourage you strongly to join us to our
 
General Assembly of Young SIETAR that will be held on
 
Saturday, 
June 29th
, 2024
 at 10 am CET
As some important decisions concerning the future of Youing Sietar will be taken, we will also offer our active membership to vote beforehand by filling out an online (
Voting by proxy for Young SIETAR General Assembly2023.docx
) document. We will contact you with further instructions some days before the GA.
Saturday, 
June 29th
, 2024
 at 10 am CET
.
Not sure what this means for your location? 
Look here:  
https://www.timeanddate.com/date/
GoToWebinar link to the GA
In order to join us online, you need to register here:
http://www.youngsietar.org/event-5767359
After you’ve registered you will receive an e-mail if your registration was successful. Please make sure to join a few minutes before the start of the GA as you may have to download the software to be able to access the webinar.
The proposed agenda for the General Assembly is as follows:
Welcome & introduction
Minutes from the GA held online 
 June 23, 2023
 - review & approval
Determination of the final agenda for the GA on June 29, 2024
Brief presentation of YS activities 2023
Secretarial & Financial overview - presentation and voting
Changes within the Board - proposal and voting
Budget 2024/5 - presentation and voting
Membership fee for the year 2024: proposal and voting
Q&A
Closure
We expect the call to last no longer than 1.5 hours.
Additional explanation on some of the agenda items:
Regarding 3.:
 
Any last minute additions/changes from the Board or proposed additions/changes by members can be incorporated into the agenda at this point before the final agenda is approved.
After the discharging of the former board members, voting will be required to approve the proposed new board members. Upon approval the new board members will be officially installed for a period of two years. The reasons for officially discharging and installing board members are legal issues, responsibilities and liability.
All members are cordially invited to apply and step up to the plate for any open position advertised.
We’re looking forward to having the General Assembly together with you on June 29, 2024 and are looking forward to holding our annual assembly virtually once again. Please do register and join.
Yours interculturally,
The Young SIETAR Board,
currently comprised of
 Inna
, Cédric, Ji-Yu, Phuong Vy, Jin, SoYoung, JiJu, Simone,  Veronique, and Christina, 
 
 
Follow us on LinkedIn
 | 
Find us on Facebook
 
 
Copyright © 2024 Young SIETAR. All rights reserved.
Contact email: 
board@youngsietar.org
 
You are receiving this message because you opted in at 
www.youngsietar.org
Unsubscribe

Subject:
 eLearning Notes
 
Hi Sarah,
 
Thank you again for presenting the eLearning today and walking us through it and thank you to Chuck and Alisa for joining today as well. I’ve prepared some notes from our call and look forward to continuing the discussion.
 
Overall Reactions
Great content and topic flow.
Text heavy (can be simplify with handouts attached for optional deeper knowledge)
Lacks video/animation, interactivity, and auditory components.
Watch outs on accessibility (include captioning on all videos, text in graphics, charts, and images/alt text options etc.)
Needs more stops on required learner interactivity to continue and complete.
Would love to see more storytelling/real world examples/case studies/scenarios.
 
eLearning Next steps
LCW Takeaways:
Send BSC eLearning link for review.
Prepare detailed timeline for completion by Sept 1.
Simplify, reduce text and move eLearning to platform similar to current LCW eLearnings (Storyline).
 
BSC Takeaways:
Review eLearning and provide any notes & feedback to LCW, however we are asking that LCW not wait for that feedback before starting the process of moving the eLearning to the new format as that our biggest concern and we are overall happy with the content direction.
 
Thanks,
Bethany

Enterprise Talent Management

You will probably see this tomorrow:) Let me know once you have reviewed it.  Please see an overview and a rationale of this PPT (attached via google drive) and attached Quiz. 
 
Canada Regionalization 2024_JK.pptx
 
 I have attached a slide deck and the quiz here below. 
 
This is a separate slide deck and the way I have prepared it is that you can select the slides that you feel make sense to include or overlap with the EMEA PPT for CDN regionalization. It just made sense to do it this way.  There's a lot of tools/practices in EMEA that are universal for inclusive leadership. I suggest integrating these slides into EMEA as you see fit. This data is well researched and all sources/reasoning is provided in the notes section below on slides
 
Here's what I have included: 
overall Canadian statistics for different ethnicities, race etc.  in Canada there is not a universal approach for the term BIPOC or racialized or visible minority. There is a lot of variation in how organizations use this term Federal govt. uses visible minority and also racialized sometimes but that excludes Indigenous people; Private and corporate businesses use it as BIPOC or racialized. 
 You will notice in the "objectives" slide I have used  BIPOC/racialized and multicultural . I suggest you keep it this way. and Here's the reason:  It is important to recognize that a blanket term like “people of colour” denies differences between members of racialized communities. (Like a few Arabs don't see themselves there) And “People of colour” should not be used to refer to Indigenous peoples as they are considered distinct societies under the Canadian Constitution. Person/people of colour and Black are not synonymous. BIPOC recognizes that while there may be some similarities between the experiences of Black, Indigenous peoples and the experiences of people of colour, there are important differences as well which need to be recognized (Juric, 2020) Some have noted that using the acronym BIPOC can suggest an interchangeability in being Black or a person of colour, thus failing to reflect the process of racialization, and suggest using “racialized” instead (Daniel, 2020).
I have made changes to the above in the objective slide (original slide from EMEA). You can do the same in other slides from EMEA. 
The presentation starts with 
The why 
(of Inclusive Leadership) from CDN context: this section includes data, stats, changing landscape of canada
What NOW
 section has a Ted Talk from Derek Sivers: this speaks to the importance of cultural competence and diverse perspectives among Leaders and leads to stereotypes and Unconscious Bias can lead to systemic discrimination as an impact.intentionally or unintentionally (some of the focus group comments speak of it ). Then a few CDN case studies that speak to unconscious bias and stereotypes. 
 
I have designed some slides that speak to focus group talking points. I think it would be useful to have a discussion around some points as in slides 23/24. 
and finally a few best practices and recommendations again from CDN study. all sources are listed there. The last slide is on communicating with Indigenous Partners/Leaders/Stakeholders
Lastly , The training has a lot of potential to facilitate an in-depth intercultural effectiveness/cross-cultural competence to your client, especially the global leaders. If you ever need support in facilitating/coaching for your clients I will be happy to collaborate. 
Let me know,
Be well,
Jas

 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Urgent tasks - this coming week / BSC Update - MAPLE GROVE UPDATE
 
Hi Vince,
 
I had to move some of these pieces forward today, I didn’t hear from you so I just forged ahead. The updated deck is here. We have a meeting with Latoya at the END of the day tomorrow, and I will need you to own the implementation of any final changes before we send to Hollina, as I am out Thurs and Fri this week.
 
Here is what I originally asked:
Boston Scientific Maple Grove SLT SCI Deck
Vince to update slides 17-20, condense into one slide with key, simple, actionable bullets – 
I did this
Vince to build out notes for activities based on input from Latoya – 
this needs to be done, but she didn’t give much input, so we can do it tomorrow together – in particular slides 32 and 40
We had also discussed slides 24-26, I worked on them a little more, but they could use your eye
GOAL – finalize by Wed 6-26
 (I’m out 6-27 & 6-28), send PDF to Hollina & Ken in preparation for meeting on July 1
 
Thanks Vince,
Sarah

 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>

c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Urgent tasks - this coming week / BSC Update
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Vince, as per our meeting today, I’m recapping the tasks I delegated to you and copying in Chuck just so he is also in the loop for how things are moving forward, especially and most critically on the BSC pieces.
 
Boston Scientific Regional Leading Inclusively Delivery Plan – 
Brian and Adriana already gave verbal agreement to do the facilitation, we will ask Latoya when we meet with her today
 
Vince to look in Compass/SOW to confirm # of sessions per region (5 APAC, 1 of which is AUS-NZ, 5 LATAM, and 1 for Canada)
Vince to email Brian, Adriana & Latoya to confirm availability for facilitation and get tentative dates
GOAL – have solid info to share with client Wed 6-26 during our meeting
 
Boston Scientific Regional Leading Inclusively Design – 
Vince to schedule a meeting with Eileen, Brian, me, Vince on Monday 6-24 (Brian traveling before), so we can get Eileen’s input on Brian’s content
We are meeting with Latoya at 2 pm – there will be to-dos after this
We are meeting with Adriana and Eileen today at 4 pm – there will be to-dos after that
Vince to coordinate tasks next week to get these drafts final (e.g., set up meetings when needed, respond to SMEs with project related info)
Vince to complete any final tasks 6-27 and 6-28 when I am out of the office 
GOAL – have compelling first drafts of 3 decks (APAC, LATAM, Canada) for the meeting on July 1
 
Boston Scientific Maple Grove SLT SCI Deck
We are talking with Latoya today about the facilitation, once we get her input…
Vince to update slides 17-20, condense into one slide with key, simple, actionable bullets
Vince to build out notes for activities based on input from Latoya 
GOAL – finalize by Wed 6-26
 (I’m out 6-27 & 6-28), send PDF to Hollina & Ken in preparation for meeting on July 1
Deck location:
 
 
GroupM Leading With Inclusion Deck
 – next draft due 6-26 at regular weekly meeting, RP is working on, RP will hand off to Sarah end of this week, Sarah will finalize 6-24 & 6-25. In the meantime:
Vince to revise timeline found here
, focusing on 2 workstreams only (Inclusion for All, Career Advocates) – please have a draft by 6-25 so I can review before the meeting 
😊
Lukeisha specifically requested: NOT to skip August as she had originally requested, to get started right away, as soon as we can finalize content (so, let’s aim for July); to start the Career Advocates program immediately (and she did NOT like the content Ada designed last time, so a hefty design time needs to be built in)
 
 
 
 
That’s it!
 
WHEW!
 
Thanks,
Sarah

Boston Scientific Regional Leading Inclusively Design – 
Vince to schedule a meeting with Eileen, Brian, me, Vince on Monday 6-24 (Brian traveling before), so we can get Eileen’s input on Brian’s content
We are meeting with Latoya at 2 pm – there will be to-dos after this
We are meeting with Adriana and Eileen today at 4 pm – there will be to-dos after that
Vince to coordinate tasks next week to get these drafts final (e.g., set up meetings when needed, respond to SMEs with project related info)
Vince to complete any final tasks 6-27 and 6-28 when I am out of the office 
GOAL – have compelling first drafts of 3 decks (APAC, LATAM, Canada) for the meeting on July 1
 
Boston Scientific Maple Grove SLT SCI Deck
We are talking with Latoya today about the facilitation, once we get her input…
Vince to update slides 17-20, condense into one slide with key, simple, actionable bullets
Vince to build out notes for activities based on input from Latoya 
GOAL – finalize by Wed 6-26
 (I’m out 6-27 & 6-28), send PDF to Hollina & Ken in preparation for meeting on July 1
Deck location:
 
 
GroupM Leading With Inclusion Deck
 – next draft due 6-26 at regular weekly meeting, RP is working on, RP will hand off to Sarah end of this week, Sarah will finalize 6-24 & 6-25. In the meantime:
Vince to revise timeline found here
, focusing on 2 workstreams only (Inclusion for All, Career Advocates) – please have a draft by 6-25 so I can review before the meeting 
😊
Lukeisha specifically requested: NOT to skip August as she had originally requested, to get started right away, as soon as we can finalize content (so, let’s aim for July); to start the Career Advocates program immediately (and she did NOT like the content Ada designed last time, so a hefty design time needs to be built in)
 
 
 
 
That’s it!
 
WHEW!
 
Thanks,
Sarah

body:
Sounds good.  My WhatsApp is my mobile:  +8526208055.  Because I'm travelling I'm not always online, so if needed please call me on WhatsApp or on my normal mobile number.  I can then call you back to talk and arrange a time to talk.  I'm pretty flexible and on holiday all week and will make it a priority to connect with you all so we can move this to closure.
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 25 June 2024 10:54 PM
To:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: For Discussion / Learning Design: Slide Deck - APAC BSC Regionalization
 
 
Thank you Brian this is awesome! We will review and circle back!
 
From:
 Brian Schroeder <brian.schroeder@ncgglobal.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 25, 2024 10:18 AM
To:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 For Discussion / Learning Design: Slide Deck - APAC BSC Regionalization
 
Hi Sarah and Vince
 
Here's the slides with additional research added on Japan and Malaysia as discussed earlier.
 
Vince, could you confirm how many minutes of added content we have?  I believe we have about 10 minutes of customized content for EMEA, so when we meet as a group with Aileen we would need to confirm that and whether to exceed that amount.  I would imagine with BSC the goal is consistency across regions while still customizing content.  
 
Based on the slides attached, we easily have enough content, and once we lock in on any key themes you wish to highlight based on what I've shared, I can build out the text for the accompanying slides.  However, I think it's best to connect with Aileen in tandem so we have a sense of the slide sequence and number.  That will enable me to write the slide content to include various aspects in addition to what people see on the slides most effectively.
 
I look forward to talking more soon.
 
Brian

subject: Re: Fall APAC sessions facilitation availability
body:
Hi Vince
Thank you for getting in touch on this.  I'd be happy to serve LCW and BSC with these sessions.
An initial quick look would be the following dates:
18 September / Wednesday
1 October / Tuesday (Golden Week Holiday in China, so less likely to attract people there but regionally should be fine)
8-10 October / Tuesday - Thursday (ideally 8 or 9 rather than 10 October)
28 November AFTERNOON ONLY / Thursday
Would something like this be doable, or would you like additional dates to offer?  If so please let me know and I can get those to you asap today or tomorrow.  I have other slots I could offer throughout autumn until the winter holidays.
Best regards
Brian

Canada Regionalization 2024_JK.pptx
 
 I have attached a slide deck and the quiz here below. 
 
This is a separate slide deck and the way I have prepared it is that you can select the slides that you feel make sense to include or overlap with the EMEA PPT for CDN regionalization. It just made sense to do it this way.  There's a lot of tools/practices in EMEA that are universal for inclusive leadership. I suggest integrating these slides into EMEA as you see fit. This data is well researched and all sources/reasoning is provided in the notes section below on slides
 
Here's what I have included: 
overall Canadian statistics for different ethnicities, race etc.  in Canada there is not a universal approach for the term BIPOC or racialized or visible minority. There is a lot of variation in how organizations use this term Federal govt. uses visible minority and also racialized sometimes but that excludes Indigenous people; Private and corporate businesses use it as BIPOC or racialized. 
 You will notice in the "objectives" slide I have used  BIPOC/racialized and multicultural . I suggest you keep it this way. and Here's the reason:  It is important to recognize that a blanket term like “people of colour” denies differences between members of racialized communities. (Like a few Arabs don't see themselves there) And “People of colour” should not be used to refer to Indigenous peoples as they are considered distinct societies under the Canadian Constitution. Person/people of colour and Black are not synonymous. BIPOC recognizes that while there may be some similarities between the experiences of Black, Indigenous peoples and the experiences of people of colour, there are important differences as well which need to be recognized (Juric, 2020) Some have noted that using the acronym BIPOC can suggest an interchangeability in being Black or a person of colour, thus failing to reflect the process of racialization, and suggest using “racialized” instead (Daniel, 2020).
I have made changes to the above in the objective slide (original slide from EMEA). You can do the same in other slides from EMEA. 
The presentation starts with 
The why 
(of Inclusive Leadership) from CDN context: this section includes data, stats, changing landscape of canada
What NOW
 section has a Ted Talk from Derek Sivers: this speaks to the importance of cultural competence and diverse perspectives among Leaders and leads to stereotypes and Unconscious Bias can lead to systemic discrimination as an impact.intentionally or unintentionally (some of the focus group comments speak of it ). Then a few CDN case studies that speak to unconscious bias and stereotypes. 
 
I have designed some slides that speak to focus group talking points. I think it would be useful to have a discussion around some points as in slides 23/24. 
and finally a few best practices and recommendations again from CDN study. all sources are listed there. The last slide is on communicating with Indigenous Partners/Leaders/Stakeholders
Lastly , The training has a lot of potential to facilitate an in-depth intercultural effectiveness/cross-cultural competence to your client, especially the global leaders. If you ever need support in facilitating/coaching for your clients I will be happy to collaborate. 
Let me know,
Be well,
Jas

Hello again Hollina,
 
Sarah trusted me with supporting you moving forward as we are preparing to get the spotlights delivered. As per your email following approval of deck, here is what Vince and I have done and now content is in the hands of the translation department ( it takes 7 to 10 working days, and we have PRIORITY HANDLING on it.) 
 
See in red my notes towards communication what you had via email with Sarah!
 
Slide 14 should be shortened to 2-3 minutes rather than the 8 outlined in speaker notes

, to 8 minutes total so that we hear more people share what actions they are going to be taking  
DONE!  
. 
I added in notes-> 
ATTENTION FACILITATOR: Action plan geared to engage participants as much as possible for a "productive" 
outcome
. 
Think
 SMART goals Specific-Measurable-Attainable-Realistic-Time-bound. MAKE IT COUNT!
 
​
Call out on not going down the rabbit hole on 
slide 12 
with the role-play – will lean heavily on Ricardo to keep the conversation productive. 
 
FACILITATOR has been briefed. 
​ His natural facilitation skills are in line with your requests
We would like a call set up with Ricardo for him to meet the Alpharetta leadership team and to review expectations.
 Here are a few times that will work for us: 
 We are now set for July 8
th
 7:30am CT. Thanks Holina for setting up teams. We confirm receipt. 
Aisha will be providing the session times by the end of next week
, but please plan for the first session to start at around 8:00 AM ET and the last session to end around 4:30/5:00 PM ET on Wednesday. We recommend that Ricardo fly in the night before for the first session.  
I am working with Ricardo to plan travel accordingly respecting travel booking & expense guidelines . 
Is it same location we had April sessions scheduled for? Could you confirm and send venue address? 
If Aisha sent the actual schedule, sorry I did not see it. Vince will need to document this internally as per LCW protocol.                         So, we are looking at 8am-5pm. Please advise if 8am is FIRST session start time, as we need to include 30-45mn arrival time and set up in training venue.  We will then need to have 4 sessions of 75mn each per day with 30mn break between AM & PM sessions + 1 hour lunch break.  
Couple of reminders:
Since the bulk of the participants are DL employees, they may be late to the session, so to ensure that we are not rushing through content, we are allowing for 
a 15-minute buffer 
after each session so that we can cover all the important points with as many people as possible. Aisha will schedule accordingly for this. 
 YES! We had spoken about 75mn sessions for that reason. That’s the plan!
LCW will provide the “Intent vs. Impact” slide as a handout for all participants – 240 copies for the 240 participants/attendees 
We usually provide the handout digitally, but Sarah indicated that you wish to have hard copies. We will therefor place an order to our external printer vendor, it will be in  “color”  quality purposes and LCW will add to BSC invoice.   To have them on site in a timely fashion we have 2 options”  . Please pick the most logical & convenient option to you: 
 
             
             Option 1) Sarah mentioned to have facilitator arrive with them.  Ricardo is in a different state than LCW offices in Chicago. So,  
             printer would be instructed to delivery to facilitator’s home address so he may travel with them in carry-on luggage. I am                          
            checking on his work/travel schedule as well to make sure there is no conflict and ample time to receive.  
 
            Option 2) Since print job needs to be shipped regardless, you also have the option to have delivery to Alpharetta site at least    
            72rs before. If you prefer this option, please advise no later than Friday June 29
th
. We would need the contact’s name and  
           address where they will be delivered in advance ( with tracking number).  
 
Wishing you a great Monday!
 
Best regards,
 
Patricia

Hi team,
 
Just checking in on this, I am pasting below the two options we had for simplified language for slide 13 – these are in the 4.12 Sharepoint deck, the one I downloaded to make the final version for signoff.
 
Hollina, can you confirm that Option 2 was the one you proposed? If so I’d like to gently push back…
 
We also discussed as a team, and we prefer Option 1 as it more closely reflects what we teach. I see a few things I would change in Option 2 – in “Understand” there is the term “cultural environment” and then “cultural community” and those two terms used together like that might be confusing. In “Accept” I would not use the term “biased” as it is very negatively connotated and I would predict folks would raise their hands and say “I’m not biased!”. For “Adapt” we thought that the language in Option 1 was simpler.
 
Overall, we recommend using Option 1. In addition, reading them over again, side by side, I would also recommend that we add in “Understand”, for the second bullet, after “shaped my own identity,” “based on the communities I have been a part of.”  
 
 
 
 
 
Eager to hear your thoughts on this so we can get this content locked down! Thank you for your collaboration.
 
Best,
Sarah

Regarding slide 13, the one we have there is the slide we prefer to use, of the various versions we considered – we like this simple wording the best for explaining the concepts. It is indeed an interactive slide, here is the activity description from the speaker notes:
4 mins
TPOTS: To remind the group of the core skill that we are teaching – cultural competence
Say: Through the Race Matters and this H/L Spotlight, we are hoping to deepen your understanding of the different cultural communities present here at Alpharetta, and to provide you with tools for building your skill in shifting perspective and adapting behavior in order to contribute to the culture of inclusion on site.
Common thread for all sessions – learning these three things to do to develop cultural competence
Ask participants to REFLECT on ONE of the statements they see here and share their experience / reflections:
-Do these stages of cultural competence make sense?
-Can you see yourself doing these things?
-What seems easy?
-What seems difficult?
 
Let us know if you are ready to review this with Alpharetta leadership, so that we can move on to translations. 
 
Thank you for your partnership!
 
Sarah

subject: FW: slide deck and quiz Attached
body:
Canada
 
From:
 Jas Kalra <kalra.jas@gmail.com> 
Sent:
 Sunday, June 23, 2024 7:00 PM
To:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 slide deck and quiz Attached
 
Happy Sunday evening Sarah,
 
Hope all's well and you had a good vacation weekend! 
 
You will probably see this tomorrow:) Let me know once you have reviewed it.  Please see an overview and a rationale of this PPT (attached via google drive) and attached Quiz. 
 
Canada Regionalization 2024_JK.pptx
 
 I have attached a slide deck and the quiz here below. 
 
This is a separate slide deck and the way I have prepared it is that you can select the slides that you feel make sense to include or overlap with the EMEA PPT for CDN regionalization. It just made sense to do it this way.  There's a lot of tools/practices in EMEA that are universal for inclusive leadership. I suggest integrating these slides into EMEA as you see fit. This data is well researched and all sources/reasoning is provided in the notes section below on slides
 
Here's what I have included: 
overall Canadian statistics for different ethnicities, race etc.  in Canada there is not a universal approach for the term BIPOC or racialized or visible minority. There is a lot of variation in how organizations use this term Federal govt. uses visible minority and also racialized sometimes but that excludes Indigenous people; Private and corporate businesses use it as BIPOC or racialized. 
 You will notice in the "objectives" slide I have used  BIPOC/racialized and multicultural . I suggest you keep it this way. and Here's the reason:  It is important to recognize that a blanket term like “people of colour” denies differences between members of racialized communities. (Like a few Arabs don't see themselves there) And “People of colour” should not be used to refer to Indigenous peoples as they are considered distinct societies under the Canadian Constitution. Person/people of colour and Black are not synonymous. BIPOC recognizes that while there may be some similarities between the experiences of Black, Indigenous peoples and the experiences of people of colour, there are important differences as well which need to be recognized (Juric, 2020) Some have noted that using the acronym BIPOC can suggest an interchangeability in being Black or a person of colour, thus failing to reflect the process of racialization, and suggest using “racialized” instead (Daniel, 2020).
I have made changes to the above in the objective slide (original slide from EMEA). You can do the same in other slides from EMEA. 
The presentation starts with 
The why 
(of Inclusive Leadership) from CDN context: this section includes data, stats, changing landscape of canada
What NOW
 section has a Ted Talk from Derek Sivers: this speaks to the importance of cultural competence and diverse perspectives among Leaders and leads to stereotypes and Unconscious Bias can lead to systemic discrimination as an impact.intentionally or unintentionally (some of the focus group comments speak of it ). Then a few CDN case studies that speak to unconscious bias and stereotypes. 
 
I have designed some slides that speak to focus group talking points. I think it would be useful to have a discussion around some points as in slides 23/24. 
and finally a few best practices and recommendations again from CDN study. all sources are listed there. The last slide is on communicating with Indigenous Partners/Leaders/Stakeholders
Lastly , The training has a lot of potential to facilitate an in-depth intercultural effectiveness/cross-cultural competence to your client, especially the global leaders. If you ever need support in facilitating/coaching for your clients I will be happy to collaborate. 
Let me know,
Be well,
Jas
 
Jas Kalra, 
P
r
o
n
ou
n
s
: She, Her 
/
 
P
r
o
n
o
m
: Elle
 Executive Coach (PCC), ICF & Facilitator
Intercultural Effectiveness, Inclusive Leadership,  Leadership Development
https://jaskalraconsulting.com/
Leadership Circle profile & EQ2.o Certified practitioner
Cell: 613-868-4387
 
Receiving this email outside of normal working hours? Managing work and life responsibilities is unique for everyone. I have sent this email at a time that works for me. Please respond at a time that works for you.”

Subject:
 Questions about the slides
 
Hi Sarah and Adriana,
 
Here is a
 link 
to the file in Dropbox. 
 
Here are some formatting questions:
 
@Sarah Nodarse
 
I moved the text into the LCW template started some formatting, and ran into some questions.
What font should be used on the slide and speaker notes?
One deck I reviewed was Roboto; the other was popping
There are two different icons to illustrate activities (chat/breakout room, etc.); which ones should be used?
One deck changes the color for each section. Should one color be used?
You said the graphic designer would "pretty" up the slides, is this true?  I moved the text to the slides using the LCW template.
Some slides are hidden, I started reading through the overall presentation and not sure if there is an option to unhide or hide some to create a more cohesive flow?
@Adriana Medina
 
You provided the quiz content in a Word document. Is the intent that the content will be turned into questions? Will participants receive the quiz as prework, and then will they discuss it during a breakout room activity?
Once I have these answers, I should be able to continue and complete.
 
Eileen
